purpleculture_pinyin:
dǎn
gall bladder; courage; guts; gall; inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)
желчный пузырь; храбрость; кишки; желчь; внутренний контейнер (например, пузырек футбольного мяча, внутренний контейнер термоса)

heisig_chinese_memo: Your gall bladder helps you digest that fatty flesh you ate last night.  Don't worry I won't snitch to your partner that you broke your diet.

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The moon has a lot of gall (gall bladder) sticking around after daybreak.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " meat " and " zhan ", the original meaning is the gallbladder, one of the digestive organs of humans and animals. "Said Wen": "Lian's liver is home. From meat, Zhan Sheng." Duan Yucai quoted from "Baihutong" as saying: "The man in the house is the Tibetan government's mansion. The daring is also the liver's mansion. The liver governs the benevolence and the benevolent. I can’t bear it, so I have courage. The benevolent must have courage.” The classics use the original meaning, such as "Suwen‧ Linglan Secret Classics": "The courageous person, the official of Zhongzheng, decides to make Yan." "Historical Records-Yue Wang Goujian Family" "The King of Yue Goujian rebels against the country, but he is struggling to think, sitting with courage, sitting on his back, and eating courage." Jian silk also uses its original meaning, such as "Mawangdui. Line 226 of "Fifty-two Prescriptions for Diseases": "The medicine is dried yellow ox gall."

" Guts " may be extended to courage, courage. "Xunzi‧ Self-cultivation": "Courageous and fierce, supplemented by Dao Shun." Yang Jie's note: "Ball, courage." Tang Dynasty Liu Cha's poem "Ask yourself": "The wine intestines are as wide as the sea, and the poem is more daring day."

" Ball " can also express one's heart. For example, in the Book of the Later Han·The Records of Emperor Guangwu: "Today I don't have the courage to perform fame and fame, but I want to keep my wife's property?" Liang Jiangyan of the Southern Dynasty "For the King of Jianping Let Zhennan Xuzhou Cishi": " To swallow the Beiru number, the love will never be there.

The parts that are installed inside the utensils and can hold water or air can also be called " bulges. " For example, the modern Chinese Mandarin "thermostat" and the Cantonese "electric bulb", etc., all use this meaning.
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " meat " and " zhan ", the original meaning is the gallbladder, one of the digestive organs of humans and animals.
humanum_full_description:
從「肉」，「詹」聲，本義為膽囊，人與動物消化器官之一。《說文》：「連肝之府。从肉，詹聲。」段玉裁引《白虎通》曰：「府者，爲藏官府也。膽者，肝之府也。肝主仁，仁者不忍，故以膽𣃔。仁者必有勇也。」典籍用本義，如《素問‧靈蘭秘典論》：「膽者，中正之官，決斷出焉。」《史記‧越王勾踐世家》：「越王勾踐反國，乃苦身焦思，置膽於坐，坐臥即仰膽，飲食亦嘗膽也。」簡帛文字也用其本義，如《馬王堆．五十二病方》第226行：「其藥曰陰乾黃牛膽」。

　　「膽」可引申為膽量、勇氣。《荀子‧修身》：「勇膽猛戾，則輔之以道順。」楊倞注：「膽，有膽氣。」唐代劉叉詩〈自問〉：「酒腸寬似海，詩膽大於天。」

　　「膽」也可表示心意，如《後漢書‧光武帝紀上》：「今不同心膽共舉功名，反欲守妻子財物耶？」南朝梁江淹〈為建平王讓鎮南徐州刺史啟〉：「吞悲茹號，情膽載絕。」

　　安裝在器物內部，可以容納水或空氣等物的部件也可稱為「膽」，如現代漢語官話「熱水瓶膽」，粵語「電燈膽」等，皆用此義。
humanum_short_description: 從「肉」，「詹」聲，本義為膽囊，人與動物消化器官之一。

從「 肉 」，「 詹 」聲，本義為膽囊，人與動物消化器官之一。《說文》：「連肝之府。从肉，詹聲。」段玉裁引《白虎通》曰：「府者，爲藏官府也。膽者，肝之府也。肝主仁，仁者不忍，故以膽𣃔。仁者必有勇也。」典籍用本義，如《素問‧靈蘭秘典論》：「膽者，中正之官，決斷出焉。」《史記‧越王勾踐世家》：「越王勾踐反國，乃苦身焦思，置膽於坐，坐臥即仰膽，飲食亦嘗膽也。」簡帛文字也用其本義，如《馬王堆．五十二病方》第226行：「其藥曰陰乾黃牛膽」。 「 膽 」可引申為膽量、勇氣。《荀子‧修身》：「勇膽猛戾，則輔之以道順。」楊倞注：「膽，有膽氣。」唐代劉叉詩〈自問〉：「酒腸寬似海，詩膽大於天。」 「 膽 」也可表示心意，如《後漢書‧光武帝紀上》：「今不同心膽共舉功名，反欲守妻子財物耶？」南朝梁江淹〈為建平王讓鎮南徐州刺史啟〉：「吞悲茹號，情膽載絕。」 安裝在器物內部，可以容納水或空氣等物的部件也可稱為「 膽 」，如現代漢語官話「熱水瓶膽」，粵語「電燈膽」等，皆用此義。
From the sound of " meat" and " zhan", the original meaning is the gallbladder, one of the digestive organs of humans and animals. "Said Wen": "Lian's liver is home. From meat, Zhan Sheng." Duan Yucai quoted from "Baihutong" as saying: "The man in the house is the Tibetan government's mansion. The daring is also the liver's mansion. The liver governs the benevolence and the benevolent. I can’t bear it, so I have courage. The benevolent must have courage.” The classics use the original meaning, such as "Suwen‧ Linglan Secret Classics": "The courageous person, the official of Zhongzheng, decides to make Yan." "Historical Records-Yue Wang Goujian Family" "The King of Yue Goujian rebels against the country, but he is struggling to think, sitting with courage, sitting on his back, and eating courage." Jian silk also uses its original meaning, such as "Mawangdui. Line 226 of "Fifty-two Prescriptions for Diseases": "The medicine is dried yellow ox gall." " Guts" may be extended to courage, courage. "Xunzi‧ Self-cultivation": "Courageous and fierce, supplemented by Dao Shun." Yang Jie's note: "Ball, courage." Tang Dynasty Liu Cha's poem "Ask yourself": "The wine intestines are as wide as the sea, and the poem is more daring day." " Ball" can also express one's heart. For example, in the Book of the Later Han·The Records of Emperor Guangwu: "Today I don't have the courage to perform fame and fame, but I want to keep my wife's property?" Liang Jiangyan of the Southern Dynasty "For the King of Jianping Let Zhennan Xuzhou Cishi": " To swallow the Beiru number, the love will never be there. The parts that are installed inside the utensils and can hold water or air can also be called " bulges." 膽字的基本解释

膽
dǎn
见“胆”。

膽字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dǎn］
［《廣韻》都敢切，上敢，端。］
“胆1”的繁体字。亦作“胆1”。
(1)胆囊的通称。
(2)胆气；胆量。
(3)犹言肝胆；心曲。
(4)安装在器物内部，可以容纳水或空气等物的部件。
(5)择取；拂拭。
(6)姓。春秋时有膽胥。见《吕氏春秋·知度》。

膽字的康熙字典解释

【未集下】【肉字部】　膽； 康熙笔画：19； 页码：页995第23
【唐韻】都敢切【韻會】【正韻】覩敢切，?音黵。【說文】連肝之府也。【廣韻】肝膽。【素問】膽者，中正之官，決斷出焉。【白虎通】膽者，肝之府也。肝主仁，仁者不忍，故以膽斷。是以肝膽二者，必有勇也。肝膽異趣，何以知相爲府也。肝者，木之精也。人怒無不色靑目張者，是其效也。【史記·越世家】坐臥卽仰膽，飮食亦嘗膽也。【前漢·張耳陳餘傳】將軍瞋目張膽。【註】張膽，言勇之甚。【後漢·光武紀】今不同心膽，共舉功名。　又【淮南子·精神訓】膽爲雲。　又【拾遺記】昆吾山有獸，食銅鐵。吳國武庫中兵刃俱食盡，得雙兔，有鐵膽，鑄爲雙劒。　又蟲名。【博雅】膽蛇，靑蠵也。　又草名。【博雅】陵遊，龍膽也。　又拭治也。【禮·內則】桃曰膽之。【註】啖食治擇之名。【疏】去毛拭治，令色靑滑如膽也。　又姓。【呂氏春秋】中牟有士曰膽胥，已請見之。

膽字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
膽字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［dǎn］
["Guangyun" dare to cut, dare to go, end. ]
The traditional characters of "胆1". Also known as "Ball 1".
(1) The general term for gallbladder.
(2) Courage; guts.
(3) Still talking about liver and gallbladder; heart song.
(4) A component that is installed inside the utensil and can contain water or air.
(5) Select and take; wipe.
(6) Last name. There is courage in the spring and autumn. See "Lu Shi Chun Qiu · Zhi Du".
